title: Why One Analyst Is Concerned the Day Before Apple's Earnings Report
text: Shares of Apple (AAPL) have surged roughly 40% over the past nine months, but one analyst said it's time to tap the brakes ahead of the company's earnings report scheduled for Thursday.

title: What DeepSeek, China, and Trump mean for Apple ahead of its Q1 earnings
text: These days, nothing is certain about the tech market or the world at large. Even NVIDIA's seemingly bulletproof stock took a hammering on Monday, enduring a $589 billion market cap decline after China-based DeepSeek raised questions for investors about more efficient AI models.

title: T-Mobile's Big 4Q Earnings, Apple & Starlink Support
text: Mike Sievert, T-Mobile CEO, joins Caroline Hyde on "Bloomberg Technology" to discuss the company's fourth-quarter earnings beat and how they secretly worked with Apple to implement Starlink service to iPhones. -------- Like this video?

title: MAG 7 (And More) Earnings: Will Last Year's Hot Stocks Soar or Flop?
text: Editor's note: Any and all references to time frames longer than one trading day are for purposes of market context only, and not recommendations of any holding time frame. Daily rebalancing ETFs are not meant to be held unmonitored for long periods.

title: Apple partners with SpaceX to support Starlink on iPhones
text: Apple Inc (NASDAQ:AAPL, ETR:APC) has reportedly collaborated with SpaceX and T-Mobile US Inc (NASDAQ:TMUS, ETR:TM5) to integrate Starlink satellite connectivity into its iPhones through its latest software update. Per a Bloomberg report, the integration allows iPhones running iOS 18.3 to connect directly to SpaceX's Starlink satellites when traditional cellular coverage is unavailable.

title: Trade Tracker: Bill Baruch buys more Apple and sells Dell
text: Bill Baruch, Founder & President Blue Line Capital, joins CNBC's “Halftime Report” to detail his latest portfolio moves.

title: Will Strong Services Offset Weak iPhone Sales for AAPL's Q1 Earnings?
text: Apple's first-quarter fiscal 2025 results are expected to reflect the negative impacts of stiff competition for iPhone, despite continuing Services growth.

title: Apple's multiple will have to fall 20% for me to be interested, says Oppenheimer's Martin Yang
text: Martin Yang, Oppenheimer senior analyst, joins 'Squawk on the Street' to discuss what Apple Intelligence is lacking that's causing consumers not to be as interested.

title: Comcast and Apple Unveil New Integrated Viewing Experience for MLS Season Pass
text: PHILADELPHIA--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Comcast and Apple Unveil New Integrated Viewing Experience For MLS Season Pass.

title: Shell, BT and Apple feature on packed Thursday
text: A packed Thursday will bring reports from BT, Shell, Sage, St James's Place, before the likes of Apple and GDP figures from across the Atlantic.

title: Apple's AI Delay Costs Market Share: Will Q1 Earnings Soften The Blow?
text: Wall Street expects Apple Inc AAPL to report $124.13 billion in revenue when the company posts first-quarter financial results after market hours Thursday.

title: QRVO Down & ASML Up: Impacts from DeepSeek & AAPL Growth
text: Qorvo Inc. (QRVO) ticked lower after its earnings initially rallied the stock. Jenny Horne talks about how Apple's (AAPL) iPhone sales played a role in trimming back its stock price.

title: Apple's AI Headaches Could Lead to Lukewarm Revenue Growth
text: Apple is reportedly expected to report muted revenue growth this week amid AI hiccups and competition in China. As Reuters reported Wednesday (Jan. 29), Apple and its competitors Samsung and Google have been counting on artificial intelligence (AI) features to boost smartphone sales.

title: DeepSeek app unavailable in Apple and Google app stores in Italy
text: The Chinese artifical intelligence application DeepSeek was not available on Wednesday in Apple and Google app stores in Italy.

title: Apple Swings to Outperformer: Is It a Buy Ahead of Earnings?
text: The release of DeepSeek's cost-effective AI model sent shockwaves through the markets on Monday, hitting the technology sector, particularly AI and semiconductor stocks, hard. The Magnificent Seven stocks, often viewed as market leaders, came under significant pressure as the new AI model challenged their dominance and raised concerns about future capital-intensive investments.

title: Why Apple stock is a ‘solid buy' right now
text: Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL) has emerged as a strong buy amid a volatile tech market, supported by a combination of technical indicators and fundamental factors.

title: Corsair Wins Multiple Prestigious Awards, Chosen by Apple to Support Gaming on Apple Devices as Peripheral Supplier
text: MILPITAS, Calif.--(BUSINESS WIRE)---- $CRSR--CORSAIR® (Nasdaq: CRSR) is pleased to be recognized as one of the Top 10 tech companies in several recent consumer reviews including PC Mag's Best Brands Index Top 10, with the highest Net Promoter Score of any top 25 gaming peripheral brand. The Company is also delighted to announce it received the Best Keyboard Award for 2025 from both The New York Times' Wirecutter and PC World for CORSAIR's K65 WL keyboard for gaming and overall usage. title: Fortune and Korn Ferry Reveal the 2025 World's Most Admired Companies List
text: Apple returns as No. 1 on the 27th version of the annual Top 50 All-Stars' List WMAC list includes 229 firms based in the U.S., 59 in Europe, 26 in Asia/Pacific region NEW YORK , Jan. 29, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- For the 18th year running, Apple leads the list of the World's Most Admired Companies.

title: Apple's sales likely hurt by AI delays, Chinese competition
text: Apple is expected to report tepid quarterly revenue growth on Thursday as its slow roll-out of artificial intelligence features and tough Chinese competition weighed on iPhone demand during the crucial holiday-shopping season.
